Application Package: Assistant Head of Primary (PYP)

st

Start Date: 1 August 2020
Application Closing Date: 25th March 2020
Employment: Position of Leadership

AMADEUS INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL VIENNA is searching for an Assistant Head of Primary (PYP) to oversee the primary years
section in support of the Head of Primary.

AMADEUS INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL VIENNA is a young, unique and dynamic IB World School (PYP, MYP and DP) located in

heritage listed buildings on a beautiful campus in Vienna. We strive to create a strong sense of community, which allows students to discover their talents during the education process. With a strong commitment to creativity and performance
throughout the school, AMADEUS has a dedicated Academy of Music and the Arts. Our excellent boarding facilities host
students from around the world as part of a school community of more than 53 nationalities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

School Administration:
  • Promote child protection and safeguarding school wide (possibly act as a Designated Safeguarding Officer)
  • Uphold and promote the school mission, vision, values, pillars of educational distinction, and behavioral framework
  • Promote the positive, collaborative, and professional culture of the school section based on the learner profile
  • Promote international mindedness and global citizenship throughout the school section
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, put measures in place for quality assurance of the teaching and learning
within the school program according to the school’s definition of high-quality teaching and learning and the relevant
IB programme.
  • Maintain a highly-visible profile in the relevant school section and provide regular instructional leadership to faculty
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, monitor student learning and wellbeing outcomes and contribute to the

development of strategies for continual improvement

  • In collaboration with the Heads of Primary and Secondary, coordinate with other assistant heads for oversight of the

relevant transitions into, out of, and between programs

  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, maintain oversight of students’ access to, and progress through, student academic and pastoral support (counseling, SEN, EAL, SSST)
  • Ensure clear and consistent communication of learning outcomes with parents, online and via parent evenings
(including scope and sequence and assessment and reporting timeframes)
  • Ensure appropriate induction, guidance and support is in place for teachers (new and returning)
  • Coordinate cover arrangements for this section
  • Participate as a member of the School Educational Leadership Team and support in steering the work of the primary
faculty (including by lending support and recommendation toward to budgeting, planning, scheduling, project
execution and resource allocation)
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, support the consistent implementation of the school behavioral
expectations
  • Oversee all standardized testing and summative examinations, group projects and graduation requirements as
relevant
  • Contribute to safety processes including building security, emergency procedures, transportation, evacuations,
lockdowns and fire drills
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, develop the timetable for the relevant section.
  • Record relevant data for use in educational decision making

Application Package: Assistant Head of Primary (PYP)

Program Coordination: - Act as the liaison person between the IBO and the School on all matters pertaining to the relevant programme
(PYP/MYP/DP)
- Ensure that all requirements of the IB concerning implementation of the program are adhered to - Ensure an outstanding educational experience of the relevant program for learners and their families which is
enhanced by AMADEUS’ unique mission, vision and context
  • Publish articles pertaining to the relevant programme within school publications
  • Ensure the full and coherent articulation and documentation of the program (PYP/MYP/DP) utilizing ManagBac
  • Ensure access to, and completion of, relevant training needs of staff as specified by the IBO; including advising the

Head of Secondary of training needs and facilitating workshop, conferences, school visits etc.

  • Take the lead in all relevant aspects of the IBO reaccreditation processes and other IBO requirements
  • In collaboration with the Head of Primary, provide quality assurance of the reporting process for the relevant school
section
This position description is not comprehensive and provides only general direction to the post-holder. Final determination of
priorities will be made between the post-holder and the line manager with respect to the school strategic and developmental
plans, and may include any other duties reasonably assigned by the Head of School.



REQUIREMENTS

Essential:

  • Has outstanding programme knowledge
  • Demonstrated excellent pedagogical practice and approaches to teaching and learning
  • Has a track record of high student attainment
  • High standards
  • Excellent organisational and communication skills
  • Deep commitment to the IB philosophy
  • Ability to teach core primary subjects to one grade
Desirable:

  • Previous leadership experience in a similar position
  • Experience as a subject/component examiner (or similar)
  • Excellent IT literacy and competence with information management systems
  • Master in Education or equivalent


WHAT WE OFFER

  • 350 Euro per month plus a 20-40% time allowance (in addition to standard teaching contract)

HOW TO APPLY

To apply for this position please forward an up-to-date CV, names of two references, and covering letter indicating your fit with
the position to jobs@amadeus-vienna.com.
